verses.text: Judge me, O \sc Lord\sc*; for I have walked in mine integrity: I have trusted also in the \sc Lord\sc*; \add therefore\add* I shall not slide.
Examine me, O \sc Lord\sc*, and prove me; Try my reins and my heart.
For thy lovingkindness \add is\add* before mine eyes: And I have walked in thy truth.
I have not sat with vain persons, Neither will I go in with dissemblers.
I have hated the congregation of evildoers; And will not sit with the wicked.
I will wash mine hands in innocency: So will I compass thine altar, O \sc Lord\sc*:
That \add I\add* may publish with the voice of thanksgiving, And tell of all thy wondrous works.
\sc Lord\sc*, I have loved the habitation of thy house, And the place where thine honour dwelleth.
Gather not my soul with sinners, Nor my life with bloody men:
In whose hands \add is\add* mischief, And their right hand is full \add of\add* bribes.
But \add as for\add* me, I will walk in mine integrity: Redeem me, and be merciful unto me.
My foot standeth in an even place: In the congregations will I bless the \sc Lord\sc*.
